meanings.sent1: The new nurse seemed to maladminister the medication, causing confusion among the patients.
meanings.sent2: The teacher did not mean to maladminister the test instructions; she just forgot to explain them clearly.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt to maladminister the recipe resulted in a surprisingly tasty dish.
meanings.sent4: The coach's decision to maladminister the team strategy led to a disastrous defeat.
meanings.sent5: The intern's tendency to maladminister tasks made her stand out for all the wrong reasons.

meanings.definition: To manage or oversee (something) in a corrupt or dishonest manner.
meanings.sent1: The corrupt official would often maladminister public funds for personal gain.
meanings.sent2: The unethical manager would maladminister the company's resources without any regard for the employees.
meanings.sent3: The villain in the movie would maladminister his evil plans, only to be foiled by the hero.
meanings.sent4: The dishonest contractor would maladminister the construction project, cutting corners at every opportunity.
meanings.sent5: The fraudulent scheme was uncovered when it was revealed that the CEO had been maladministering company assets for years.
